data.chText: 极为恶劣的；十分严重的

data.enText: a severe winter (= one during which the weather conditions are extremely bad)

data.chText: 该党在上次选举中遭到惨败。
data.enText: The party suffered severe losses during the last election.
a severe shortage of qualified staff
punishing sb in an extreme way when they break a particular set of rules

data.chText: 法庭对青少年犯罪者的处罚趋于严厉。
data.enText: The courts are becoming more severe on young offenders.
not kind or sympathetic and showing disapproval of sb/sth

data.chText: 她是个严肃的女人，脸上很少出现笑容。
data.enText: She was a severe woman who seldom smiled.

data.chText: 艰难的；艰巨的；难度很大的
data.enText: extremely difficult and requiring a lot of skill or ability

data.chText: 马拉松赛跑是对耐力的严峻考验。
data.enText: The marathon is a severe test of stamina.
extremely plain and lacking any decoration

data.chText: 现代家具有点过于简朴，我不大喜欢。
data.enText: Modern furniture is a little too severe for my taste.

data.chText: 她的头发不长，也没有花样。
data.enText: Her hair was short and severe.
Anyone breaking the law will be severely punished.

data.chText: 一篇措辞严厉的批评报道
她的头发简单地盘成了一个发髻。
data.enText: Her hair was tied severely in a bun.

data.chText: 刑期长短要和罪行轻重一致。
data.enText: A prison sentence should match the severity of the crime.

data.chText: 能否彻底康复取决于她受伤的严重程度。
data.enText: The chances of a full recovery will depend on the severity of her injuries.

data.chText: 他沉下脸来，装出一副严厉的样子。
精致的门面同室内的简朴形成强烈反差。
data.enText: The elaborate facade contrasts strongly with the severity of the interior.

simple_means.memory_skill: sever 诚恳 + e → 态度诚恳 → 严肃的

ex.enText: The general had a severe manner.

ex.chText: 我的老师对所有迟到的学生都同样严厉。
ex.enText: My teacher was equally severe on students who were late for class.

ex.chText: 首相对这场危机的处理受到了强烈批评。
ex.enText: The Prime Minister came under severe criticism for his handling of the crisis.

synonyms.bx: 形容人时指某人神态严肃的或待人处事要求严格、不讲情面的；形容事物时指法律、批评等异常严厉的，近乎苛刻。

ex.chText: 他是一个冷酷无情的人。
我没想到他会这么铁石心肠。
ex.enText: I had no idea he could be so cold-hearted.

synonyms.bx: 指人的举动令人觉得毫无怜悯之心的。

d: 冷酷无情的，铁石心肠的

ex.chText: 他父亲是个不讲情面的人。
ex.enText: His father was a hard man.

ex.chText: 她对待自己的助手太苛刻了。
ex.enText: She is too hard on her assistant.

synonyms.bx: 指对他人过分严厉的、苛刻的。

d: 冷酷无情的，严厉刻薄的

ex.chText: 他受到了同事们的严厉批评。
ex.enText: He suffered harsh criticism from his colleagues.

ex.chText: 昨天英语老师严厉责罚了他。
ex.enText: He received a harsh punishment from his English teacher yesterday.

ex.chText: 批评家对她的新著只有苛刻的批评。
ex.enText: The critics had nothing but harsh words for her new book.

synonyms.bx: 指对待他人或对他人的批评非常严厉的、苛刻的。

tr: causing fear or anxiety by threatening great harm
very bad in degree or extent
unsparing and uncompromising in discipline or judgment
example: a parent severe to the pitch of hostility"- H.G.Well
a hefty six-footer with a rather severe mien

tr: intensely or extremely bad or unpleasant in degree or quality
example: under wicked fire from the enemy's guns
a hard left to the chin

value.def: You use severe to indicate that something bad or undesirable is great or intense.

example.ex: ...a business with severe cash flow problems...
example.tran: 有严重资金周转问题的公司

example.ex: I suffered from severe bouts of depression...
example.tran: 我曾患有严重的抑郁症。

example.ex: Steve passed out on the floor and woke up blinded and in severe pain...
example.tran: 史蒂夫昏倒在地板上，醒来后什么也看不见了，还感到剧烈的疼痛。

example.ex: Shortages of professional staff are very severe in some places.
example.tran: 有些地方专业人员严重短缺。

value.tran: 十分严重的;极为恶劣的

example.ex: The UN wants to send food aid to 10 countries in Africa severely affected by the drought...
example.tran: 联合国希望给非洲 10 个旱情严重的国家输送食物援助。

example.ex: An aircraft overshot the runway and was severely damaged.
example.tran: 一架飞机冲出了跑道，严重受损。

example.ex: Several drugs are used to lessen the severity of the symptoms.
example.tran: 使用了几种药来减轻症状。

value.def: Severe punishments or criticisms are very strong or harsh.

example.ex: This was a dreadful crime and a severe sentence is necessary...
example.tran: 这一罪行十分恶劣，必须要重判。

example.ex: Before she could reply, my mother launched into a severe reprimand.
example.tran: 她还没来得及回答，我妈妈就开始严厉地训斥起她来。

value.tran: (惩罚、批评)严厉的，严重的，苛刻的

example.ex: ...a campaign to try to change the law to punish dangerous drivers more severely.
example.tran: 试图修改法律以加重对危险驾车者处罚力度的运动

example.ex: The Bishop said he was sickened by the severity of the sentence...
example.tran: 主教说他对如此重的量刑大为震惊。

example.ex: Believers were treated with the same severity as the Christians had been a few years earlier.
example.tran: 和几年前的基督徒一样，信徒们受到了同样严厉的对待。

value.def: If you describe the appearance of someone or something as severe, you do not like its plain appearance and lack of decoration.

example.ex: ...wearing her felt hats and severe grey suits...
example.tran: 戴着她的毡帽，穿着朴素的灰色套装

example.ex: The cushions add a touch of colour in a room that might otherwise look severe.
example.tran: 靠垫给房间添了一抹亮色，不然房间看上去可能太素净了。

value.tran: (外貌、外观)简朴的，朴素的,不加修饰的

example.ex: When women started working in offices, they opted for severity in dress in order to imply sobriety.
example.tran: 女性开始在办公室上班后，就会选择朴素而简洁的着装，以看上去持重冷静。

trans: 重度不典型增生；异生；重度病变；重度异生；重度化生
严冬；寒冬；嚴冬；寒冬腊月
苛刻条件；深度反应条件
重症病毒；严重型病毒株

partsOfSpeech.dec: as 加强 + sever 诚恳 + ate 做 → 一再诚恳表示 → 郑重声明
sever 诚恳 + e → 态度诚恳 → 严肃的
